Package actions

Class ActionGenerator_FixedSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • actions.ActionGenerator_FixedSequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IActionGenerator
    public class ActionGenerator_FixedSequence
extends java.lang.Object
implements IActionGenerator
    Assigns potential action choices to nodes. This fixed sequence version has an ActionSet for each subsequent Action choice, and cycles through these choices. This is a more general version of the fixed nil/nil - WO - nil/nil - QP sequence I've used for quite awhile. Also, action "exceptions" can be specified to override the normal ActionSet in the cycle. This can be useful for defining a different set of actions for the first few steps when the runner is getting moving.
    Author:
    matt

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActionGenerator_FixedSequence

        public ActionGenerator_FixedSequence​(ActionSet[] repeatedActions,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​ActionSet> actionExceptions)
        This action generator will produce the nil-WO-nil-QP sequence. actionRepeats will be chosen in repeating order like 1234,1234,1234, or 123,123,123, etc. Note that this starts from tree root EVEN if there are action exceptions. However, action exceptions for specified tree depths will be chosen over the repeating actions if they are assigned.
        Parameters:
        repeatedActions - An array of ActionSet, with one for every choice in the sequence. Each subsequent choice (increasing depth in the tree) cycles through the action sets and wraps when at the end of the ActionSets.
        actionExceptions - A Map of integer indexes to ActionSet. When the sequences reach a tree depth specified in the map, it will use the ActionSet corresponding to this index rather than the normal ActionSet in the cycle.

    • Method Detail

      • getPotentialChildActionSet

        public ActionSet getPotentialChildActionSet​(Node parentNode)
        Description copied from interface: IActionGenerator
        Get an ActionSet of potential actions to explore from a newly created node as its potential children.
        Specified by:
        getPotentialChildActionSet in interface IActionGenerator
        Parameters:
        parentNode - Node for which we want to pick potential child actions.
        Returns:
        A set of actions to try as potential children.
